title: 100 Followers Problem (Calculus)!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{\lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n \ln{\left[\left(1+\frac{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}{n}\right)^{\cos\theta} \left(1+\frac{\cos\theta}{n}\right)^{\cot\theta} \left(1+\frac{\cot\theta}{n}\right)^{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}\right]}d\theta}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose the value of the above limit can be expressed in the form: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ln\left({\frac{(\sqrt{A} + 1)^B}{\sqrt{C}}}\right) +\left(\frac{1}{D} - \frac{1}{\sqrt{E}}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A,B,C,D,E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers, and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A,C,E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are square free.
Then what is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A+B+C+D+E "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/9LR6eXv28Q-a-theorem.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First of all, understand what the above theorem says. It's very simple to understand, for those who don't know it, and I expect a lot of people to know it."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Denote "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = \left(1+\frac{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}{n}\right)^{\cos\theta} , Q=\left(1+\frac{\cos\theta}{n}\right)^{\cot\theta}, R=\left(1+\frac{\cot\theta}{n}\right)^{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus we have the integral as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{[PQR]}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta +\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(Q)}\ d\theta+ \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta +\int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(Q)} \ d\theta+ \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3}  \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty}  n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{\ln{(1+\frac{\sec\theta \tan\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\sec\theta}{n}}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{\tan\theta\ln{(1+\frac{\sec\theta \tan\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\sec\theta\tan\theta}{n}}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \tan\theta \ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(Q)}\ d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \cot\theta\cos\theta\frac{\ln{(1+\frac{\cos\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\cos\theta}{n}}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \cot\theta\cos\theta \ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3}\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \sec\theta\frac{\ln{(1+\frac{\cot\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\cot\theta}{n}}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \sec\theta \ d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore we obtain:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta +\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(Q)}\ d\theta+ \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \left(\tan\theta + \cot\theta\cos\theta + \sec\theta \right) \ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And solving this elementary definite integral gives us the value:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ln\left({\frac{(\sqrt{3} + 1)^2}{\sqrt{6}}}\right) +\left(\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{A+B+C+D+E = \boxed{15}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 100 Follower Problem NumberTheory
100 follower question!

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"too easy ! "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle{I=\int _{ \cfrac { -\pi  }{ 4 }  }^{ n\pi -\cfrac { \pi  }{ 4 }  }{ \left| \sqrt { 2 } \sin { (x+\cfrac { \pi  }{ 4 } ) }  \right|  } dx\\ I=\sqrt { 2 } \int _{ 0 }^{ n\pi  }{ \left| \sin { t }  \right|  } dt=\sqrt { 2 } n\int _{ 0 }^{ \pi  }{ \left| \sin { t }  \right| dt } \\ I=2\sqrt { 2 } n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
